caseTitle: Shahida Bibi, etc v. Habib Bank Ltd, etc
tagline: The Banking Tribunals Ordinance, 1984 or the Banking Companies (Recovery of Loans, Advances, Credits and Finances) Ordinance/Act, 1997 are special laws and the Banking Tribunal/Court in execution proceedings could adopt any procedure it deemed fit for the sale of the mortgaged property other than the one prescribed by the said laws and having once adopted a mode of execution as set out in the CPC an executing court can deviate therefrom with due application of mind and upon assigning justifiable reasons. Correct law has been laid down in the case of Muhammad Attique v. Jami Limited (PLD 2010 SC 993) and the judgment delivered in Asma Zafarul Hassan v. M/s United Bank Ltd. (PLJ 1981 SC 242) (1981 SCMR 108) is not the correct law.
